Key Match Events: The Padres grabbed a 3-0 lead in the first inning when San Diego's Manny Machado followed shortstop Tyler Fitzgerald's two-run throwing error with a home run off rookie right-hander Mason Black.
Pre-Game Insights: Giants manager Bob Melvin defends his hitting coaches: 'They've done a fantastic job'
Giants manager Bob Melvin says his hitters are as prepared as they could be for opposing starters.
Post-Match Reflections: Viele offered a few ideas about the lack of early scoring. Maybe some of the younger hitters like Bailey feel compelled to attack the first pitch because they are anxious at the prospect of taking a first-pitch strike and being behind in the count.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Giants are among the least productive teams at applying early pressure and generating early offense. They’ve scored 179 runs in the first three innings, which ranks 26th in the major leagues — better than only the Miami Marlins, Pittsburgh Pirates, Los Angeles Angels and Chicago White Sox.
The Giants have been at their best when they’re in comeback mode. But playoff teams don’t have comeback mode as their default setting.
Others: Giants hitting coach Justin Viele said, 'I think we have to revisit this philosophically going into the offseason and see if there are adjustments to be made.'

Giants outfielder Mike Yastrzemski said, 'They care more than anybody. They give you all the information you could possibly need, and they do a really good job of keeping it away from certain guys who don’t like to get as much of it.'
